issue.title: [C++] Improve performance on dictionaries for 'case_when' kernel
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14042](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14042). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11022#discussion_r712162040>

If we change the dictionary builders to allow separately encoding a new value (and getting back and index) and appending a dictionary item index, we could avoid re-encoding the same values over and over.
